channel.title: Zodiac Signs Changed?
channel.description:
Quite the fuss about whether or not the new zodiac signs that were released today means your astrological sign changed. People everywhere are having an identity crisis. Am I a Gemini or a Taurus? Am I a Virgo or a Leo? What does it all mean? Well, Professor Parke Kunkle of the Minnesota Planetarium Society opened his mouth and said the Zodiac had a problem with the dates. Not only is the Earth aligned differently today than it was in 3000 BC, but we’ve also been leaving the constellation Ophiuchus out of the equation. So, Kunkle added them back in, told the world about it, and the brains of those who believe in astrology all exploded as we tried to figure out if taking the new job was really the wrong move, and whether or not we want potato leek soup or anise squash soup for dinner. Yep, your astrological signs also determine your food cravings, too. See if you changed zodiac signs after the jump. The Old Zodiac Signs Aquarius: Jan 20 – Feb 18 Pisces: Feb 19 – March 20 Aries: March 21 – April 19 Taurus: April 20 – May 20 Gemini: May 21 – June 20 Cancer: June 21 – July 22 Leo: July 23 – August 22 Virgo: August 23 – Sept 22 Libra: Sept 23 – Oct 22 Scorpio: Oct 23 – Nov 21 Sagittarius: Nov 22 – Dec 21 Capricorn: Dec 22 – Jan 19 The New Zodiac Sign Dates: Capricorn: Jan. 20 – Feb. 16 Aquarius: Feb. 16 – March 11 Pisces: March 11- April 18 Aries: April 18- May 13 Taurus: May 13- June 21 Gemini: June 21- July 20 Cancer: July 20- Aug. 10 Leo: Aug. 10- Sept. 16 Virgo: Sept. 16- Oct. 30 Libra: Oct. 30- Nov. 23 Scorpio: Nov. 23- Nov. 29 Ophiuchus: Nov. 29- Dec. 17 Sagittarius: Dec. 17- Jan. 20
http://blogs.babble.com/family-kitchen/2011/01/13/new-zodiac-signs-2011-did-your-sign-change/ [hr] Someone needs to call up the zodiac killer, he seemed to have missed someone.

item.title: Zodiac Signs Changed?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:38, topic:378270”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=474147.msg3470491#msg3470491 date=1295255773]

It’s their job to present news in a way that is interesting enough to people to make them want to read it. Otherwise no one would read it and they would be out of a job.

@yakman, I love that guy’s response when asked for clarification.

Interesting, Yes. But they shouldn’t present every article as if it’s something sensational.
[/quote]News isn’t news… News is a reality TV show without actors…[/quote]They still have a script to follow, I can see there eyes move back and forth reading the board.

Read full topic

item.title: Zodiac Signs Changed?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:29, topic:378270”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=474147.msg3468230#msg3468230 date=1295099879]
do people actually believe this?
[/quote]
Doubt it. But let’s face it, bull > ram in terms of brute strength and stuff like that. I don’t read horoscopes and that sort of thing.[/quote]

Weep for humanity.

http://www.facebook.com/notes/equinox-astrology/bbcs-wonders-of-the-solar-system-astrology/384769273320

The BBC recently broadcast a spectacular and most impressive astronomy series entitled the 'Wonders of the Solar System'. While it was highly informative, the presenter physicist Professor Brian Cox made an unfortunate chance remark dismissing astrology as rubbish.

[…]

His careless assertion was unresearched, unsubstantiated and unscientific. Has he done any empirical studies? Has he explored his birth chart? Can he cite any scientific studies disproving astrology that are not fundamentally flawed? Of course not. I have certainly never seen him at an astrology conference or read anything written by him about astrology. Cox is simply not qualified to speak on astrology and his comments amount to no more than prejudice.

Cox’s reply was:

In the film I said Astrology was "a load of rubbish" and the BBC asked for a statement about this after some criticism so I said "I apologise to the astrology community ...for not making myself clear, I should have said that this new age drivel is undermining the very fabric of our civilisation".

Read full topic

item.title: Zodiac Signs Changed?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:26, topic:378270”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=474147.msg3467580#msg3467580 date=1295049452]
i hate how everyone is talking about this bullshit
[/quote]

I hate how the local newspaper, The Ottawa Sun, used the word “astronomy” instead of “astrology” through-out the whole article.

They were refering to no-name gypsy psychic people as astronomers etc. Kinda pissed me off for some reason.[/quote]

Shit like that happens a lot. Journalists that don’t know anything about science or technology still write articles about it. So people go batshit about it.

There is a Dutch news site, which is quite popular. Not only do they write about topics they don’t know anything about, they also make the article title sound like something sensational has, or will happen.

Read full topic
